intro: Patagonium stipulaceum, commonly known as the Patagonian thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer. The plant is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the harsh climate of Patagonia. It has a compact growth form and is often used in local traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in arid environments.
